intro: Euphrasia irenae, commonly known as the Irish eye or the lesser eyebright, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange, with dark markings resembling eyes. The plant has oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Euphrasia irenae is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. It is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye ailments and respiratory conditions.
